intro.p: A study was conducted to investigate a relationship between the colors of helmets worn by motorcycle drivers and whether they are injured or killed in a crash. Results are given in the table below. Use this table to answer the questions, assuming that one of the motorcycle drivers has been randomly selected.

Make sure to show your computations and to give reasons ( in words) about how you came up with your answers. Round your answer to four decimal places. Failure to show all computations or incorrect rounding may results in a score of "not mastered".

content.p: Calculate the totals for the cells labeled A, B, and C in the table.
What is the probability that a randomly selected piece of clothing was a {{wear1}} that was {{color1}}?
What is the probability that a randomly selected piece of clothing was {{color2}} or {{color3}}?
Of the {{color4}} color clothing, what is the probability that a randomly selected piece of clothing was a {{wear2}}?
What is the probability that a randomly selected piece of clothing was NOT a {{color5}} piece of clothing?
